Articles.Content:
after 18 days since my post on the international Forum no arabic replied , its really sad not to see anyone from my country or a speaker of my language , i hope one day i'll find someone , maybe there is people playing KSP from the middle east but not active on the forum :/

i'm just hoping one day i'll see someone.
For what it's worth, your english seems excellent. Welcome to the rest of the forum.

Its unfortunate no one else from your country plays, that must make you feel lonely. With that said, I feel I speak for the community as a whole when I say you're very welcome here so these times don't have to be quite as sad.

(Also, Tater is correct; your English is exceptional! Great job!)
Well, sorry I can't greet your in your native language, but yes, you are welcome in the other parts of the forum.

For the record, if it helps: Your English is much better than my Arabic

Seriously, though: Don't feel like you're unwelcome just because you haven't found anyone else who speaks your native language. The users here come from many different nations and backgrounds, but hopefully we're all united by our love for the game and the experiences it allows us to share with one another.
Dude! Get in here! Welcome to the KSP family! Trust me, in these forums, you'll never be lonely!
Hey I thought I was the only player of my type until I look over on the KSP facebook. There are many like me, maybe you could find them there?
greetings from the other side of our planet!
Hey, we're from all over the world. Your english is far better than that of many natives I have met. Welcome to the "main" forum!

Welcome aboard! I know a teeny tiny bit of arabic, most of it with Baghdad style slang. "Ismee Abu Shuwarab. Inta schlonek zein? Ani zein!"

And of course, you are always welcome here with us! Welcome to the wonderful world of small flying green aliens and interesting worlds to visit.

Salam Alekum!

There are no borders in space. We're all one race up there. So don't worry that there are no other Saudis active on these boards, you'll find plenty of advice, good chats and friends here, regardless of peoples' country of origin.
I didn't realize that we even had an international section. I gotta check that one out!

Hmm. I was sure I saw someone's avatar with what looked like Arabic writing in it, I thought it was WinkAllKerb'. Looking at his profile though, it looks like it's been changed and he hasn't been active for over a month.

Edited October 24, 2014 by Red Iron Crown
welcome to the rest of the forums this is the best internet community around, and here youll always find friends Salam Alekum.
Welcome to the community Abdu, as you can see it doesn't matter what language you speak, we're all fans of KSP and space here

My native language is german and i spend most of my time here in the main sections of the forum. It is full of nice people. Just have sone fun and interesting conversations, its worth a while. Oh... And welcome to the forums Abdu! Cool to have you on board.

I saw that Arabic post a while ago with no responses. It's sad.

Anyway salaam alaikum. It's the only Arabic I know (only polite thing anyway).
Thanks everyone for the kind words really appreciated , the replies really show how great this community is, once again thank you <3

You guys are all so nice!

Also, Abdu, if you ever have trouble with English you can always just copy and paste out of Google Translate!

Ã˜ÂªÃ˜Â±Ã˜Â­Ã™Å Ã˜Â¨

(It says welcome for any one who can't read Arabic)

Edited October 24, 2014 by worir4
Ah we are united by our love of Jebidiah and his crazy green friends! Welcome.
Welcome to this side of the forums. Just remember when all else fails.. More boosters.

Normally the international section of the forums moves more slow, spanish section (my language) had less than 15 posts this October. My normal lurking grounds are "General", "Gameplay Questions and Tutorials" and "Challenges". Suprisingly I've encountered many spanish speaking players that never visited the international section, some of them where surprised to know there is one to begin with.

Welcome aboard, let's practice our english speaking skills together
Welcome to the forums!
Heh, welcome to the forums! It's truly a wonderful time we live in when hundreds of people from around the world can get onto one place to discuss similar interests

I know so little arabic that I wouldn't be able to carry on a conversation.

About all I can do is say hello.
